wikipedia_page.main: William Henry Beach  (1871 – 22 July 1952) was a senior British Army officer who played an important role in the campaign in Mesopotamia 1915 to 1918.

response: :* William Henry Beach (1871–1952), British Army officer
*Brigadier-General Sir William Henry Beach CB CMG DSO

Born at Brompton on 28 May 1866, the elder son of the Rev. Canon W. R. Beach, Chaplain to the Forces, and was educated at Bloxham Schoolhttp://oldbloxhamist.bloxhamschool.com/The%20Bloxhamist/1941_04.pdf (1880–84)http://oldbloxhamist.bloxhamschool.com/The%20Bloxhamist/1933_12.pdf and at King's College Hospital, where he gained the Warneford Scholarship and worked under Joseph Lister.http://www.archives.kingsimages.net/exhibitions/lister/listerscolleaguesdetail/students.cfm He took the M.R.C.S., L.R.C.P. in 1899 and, after serving as house-physician at King's, entered the Army as surgeon in 1891, passing first both into and out of Netley. There he gained the Herbert Prize allotted to the best man of the term and the Montefiore Medal and Prize for Military Surgery. He was the brother of William Henry Beach.
* William Henry Beach (1871–1952), British Army officer
* Maj-Gen William Henry Beach, CB, CMG, DSO, formerly of the Royal Engineers, commander of 42nd (EL) Division, appointed 29 April 1931
